SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.Level3

Class LevelThree

java.lang.Object
java.util.Observable
com.example.demo.Levels.LevelParent
com.example.demo.Level3.LevelThree
public class LevelThree extends LevelParent
Represents the third level of the game. This class extends LevelParent and introduces a unique mechanic of shield usage for the player's plane and spawning enemies.

      public LevelThree(double screenHeight, double screenWidth, GameController controller)

      screenHeight - The height of the game screen.
      screenWidth - The width of the game screen.
      controller - The game controller.

    • handleKeyPress

      private void handleKeyPress(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
      Handles key press events, specifically checking for the Enter key to activate the shield.
      Parameters:
      event - The key event.

    • deactivateShieldAfterTimeout

      private void deactivateShieldAfterTimeout(UserPlane userPlane)
      Deactivates the shield after 7 seconds and starts the cooldown period before the shield can be used again.
      Parameters:
      userPlane - The user's plane that owns the shield.

    • waitForShieldCooldown

      private void waitForShieldCooldown()
      Handles the cooldown period and shows the "Use shield" message again after 5 seconds.

    • spawnEnemyUnits

      protected void spawnEnemyUnits()
      Spawns enemy units at random positions on the screen based on a defined spawn probability. The method ensures that a certain number of enemies are present on the screen at all times.
      Specified by:
      spawnEnemyUnits in class LevelParent

    • instantiateLevelView

      protected LevelView instantiateLevelView()
      Instantiates the level view for LevelThree.
      Specified by:
      instantiateLevelView in class LevelParent
      Returns:
      A new instance of LevelView for LevelThree.

    • userHasReachedKillTarget

      private boolean userHasReachedKillTarget()
      Checks whether the user has reached the kill target to advance to the next level.
      Returns:
      true if the user has reached the kill target, otherwise false.
